form_name: Antimigraine Agents, Vyepti (Eptinezumab-jmmr) Prior Authorization (PA) Form
provider: HealthKeepers, Inc. | Anthem HealthKeepers Plus Medicaid products
instructions: If the following information is not complete, correct, or legible, the PA process can be delayed. Please use one form per member.

drug_information_continued.preferred_agents_cannot_be_used: The patient has tried multiple medications and prefers Vyepti over Botox.

question_1.text: Does the member have a diagnosis of migraine with or without aura based on International Classification of Headache Disorders (ICHD-III) diagnostic criteria?

question_2.text: Is the member ≥ 18 years of age?

question_3.text: Has the member been utilizing prophylactic intervention modalities (for example, pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, physical therapy, etc.)?

question_4.text: Does the member have a diagnosis of chronic migraines defined as 15 or more headache (tension-type-like and/or migraine-like) days per month for > three months?

sub_questions.text: Member has had at least five attacks with features consistent with migraine (with and/or without aura);
On at least eight days per month for > three months:
Headaches have characteristics and symptoms consistent with migraine;
Member suspected migraines are relieved by a triptan or ergot derivative medication;

Member has failed at least an eight-week trial of any two oral medications for the prevention of migraines (for example, antidepressants, beta blockers, antiepileptics) prior to initiation of eptinezumab;
Member had an inadequate response (or unable to tolerate) a minimum trial of at least two preferred self-injectable CGRP options;

left_blank: The NPI number in the prescriber information section.
The Medicaid ID number in the member information section.
The length of therapy in the drug information section.
The address, city, state, and zipcode in the demographics section.
